title: Weight Loss
description: Michael tries to motivate the Scranton branch to lose weight as part of an interoffice competition. Jim is lost after Pam leaves for art school in New York, and Angela continues to see Dwight even though she is now engaged to Andy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, everybody. This is your last meal, so eat up. [cheering]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: From this point forward, you will not use the bathroom. We need to keep our starting weights high so we can lose more.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This summer, corporate is sponsoring a little weight loss contest between the branches. Whichever branch loses the most weight gets three extra vacation days.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What should we do with all these leftovers?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm taking the dumplings for my wife.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. This is your last meal. There will be no leftovers.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I can bring these to my shelter.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm taking my dumplings.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sprays food with bug poison] There. Take those home to your wife.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, it's time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hit the scales, everybody. Right on that black platform. This way. Step it up.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Don't go breaking my scale.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm excited to lose weight for the wedding, because I really want to have washboard abs the first time Angela sees me naked.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ex-squeeze me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I will ex-squeeze you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK everybody. Get used to this because we are going to be standing here briefly every Monday for the next seven Mondays.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait a minute. One more bite of eclair each. Hold it in your mouth if you can't swallow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [smiles, looks to Michael]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm totally gonna slaughter at the weigh-in today.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: All I had this weekend to eat was a chicken breast and a case of Diet Coke.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really? 'Cause I haven't eaten anything since noon on Friday.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: OK. [holds elevator] Stanley, come on.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, I forgot something in my car. I'll see you guys up there. [takes the stairs after the elevator doors close]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I happen to be losing weight on my own for my own reasons. The truth is, I have lost a little of my speed, a little of my fire. Here's what I used to look like. [holds up old photo] Look at those biceps. We were fighting the power and eating whatever we wanted.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: And arch your back. And slowly bring up your head. [Michael and Holly face each other in yoga pose]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jimbo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, they moved the shower.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you see Holly's butt?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I didn't. [Michael laughs] You know why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Because most of the time, friends don't talk about other friends' butts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But what have you learned about her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I learned that she broke her left leg twice in one year. I learned that she's allergic to sesame seeds. I learned that she has read "Lonesome Dove" three times.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that her butt refuses to quit!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I tried. [Michael laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [follows Jim into bathroom] You have to agree with me. [follows Jim back out] That's insane.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll just go later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I thought you had to pee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [forces candy out of vending machine and forces fruit into racks]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, if you're into yoga, I take a great bikram class in Dickson City.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. I should check that out.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Also -- and no pressure -- the teacher? He's a catch.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Actually, I'm a lesbian.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm gay!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm not a lesbian. I don't know why I said that... It's a joke.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What's the joke?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: There is no joke. I just said it because I haven't had much luck lately and I'm not really looking to date. Maybe I should switch to women.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, you think it's a choice?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Um, I'm gonna head back to my work area and just-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm messing with you, Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I knew that. OK, bye.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So you have the directions.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You have a toothbrush.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You have a cell phone charger.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have everything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tomorrow I start a three-month design program at the Pratt Institute in New York. I will be a little fish in the big apple. [does hand gesture] What up, 212?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fax this for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on, man. She goes to New York in like 10 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not gonna take her 10 minutes to fax it, Jim. [to Pam] If I don't see you again, goodbye. Well, actually, I'll see you when you give me the fax confirmation, so never mind.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ang. Ela. [sings] Ella, ella, ella. Under my Angerela. Ella, ella, ella. Ay, ay-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, check it out. [hands her brochure] This is The Breakers, Newport, Rhode Island. Huge, awesome gorgeous mansion overlooking the Atlantic. And my dad went to Cornell with the current groundskeeper.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Every little boy fantasizes about his fairy-tale wedding.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is where my parents decided not to get divorced.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't care.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK. How do you feel about Maine? [Angela picks up phone and dials] I'm on it. I'll see you later, love. [Dwight's pager vibrates, he and Angela walk out]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [exiting warehouse storage room] Ahh. We done good in there, half pint.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, that was the last time, Dwight. I mean it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Monkey. [kisses her]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, no. I have a fiance I very much like!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sees Pam and Jim through office window, runs out the office] Hey, hey! [falls down stairs, gets up, falls down again] Pam, Pam! Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [frazzled and out of breath] I wrote you a goodbye poem. It's really long. I left it up in my office. Could you just please wait till I go get it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I should really get going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. OK. Um, the last word is "seagulls."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sure it was really lovely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I took a lot from other poems.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Call me when you get in. [kisses Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, call- [leans in to kiss Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why haven't I proposed yet? Uh, actually Pam and I talked about it. And we just decided that, um -- well, we didn't want to spend first three months of our engagement apart. And Pam's always said she doesn't want a long engagement. Something in her past, I guess. I'm not really sure of the whole story, but something about a guy who used to work here...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, no, no, no, no, no, no. Same places as last week.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It doesn't matter, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, it does. No, this is about weight displacement. We have to have the same weight distribution. Right here. Here we go. Let's move that up. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, fancy meeting you here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: OK, everybody smile. Ho! You lost 31 pounds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't believe I'm saying this, but Michael is actually killing it with Holly. And I think I know why. It's because Holly is kind of a major dork.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [rapping] I'm MC Mike Scott, and I am hot. She's DJ Jazzy Flax, and she is the best. All those sucker branches can suck our fat!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Wikka wikka wikka what?

quotes.speaker: Ronnie
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Ronnie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't really know Ronnie. But I have a feeling I will get to know her very well over the next few years, and eventually declare my love for her.

quotes.speaker: Professor
quotes.text: Sorry I'm late. I accidentally switched my alarm clock setting to Zapf Chancery. [laughter] Which is my terrible segue into our course, Expressive Typography in New Media.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm in the wrong class...

quotes.speaker: Professor
quotes.text: Some of you may remember from last semester I am Professor Monaghan. [sees Pam leaving] And looks like I'm boring someone already.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no. I just-

quotes.speaker: Professor
quotes.text: Please sit down.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You're shaking. Are you all right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Just leave me alone!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [sickly] I am on the third day of my cleanse diet. All I have to do is drink maple syrup, lemon juice, cayenne pepper and water for all three meals. Um, I just bought some bikinis online, size 2. So ... gonna look amazing.

quotes.speaker: Ronnie
quotes.text: Hi, can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I need you to make me 100 copies of this on canary yellow.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: How's the candle game?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, great. Yeah, Serenity by Jan is kicking ass and taking names. You remember last week when that girl went missing?  Guess whose candles they used for the vigil?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool. Thank God they found her, too.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, they found her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, Jan. Hello, baby. How are you? Good to see you. Who's your daddy? You don't know who your daddy is, do you? No, you don't. [to Jan] Come on. Let's go in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When Michael told us that Jan was pregnant, he led us to believe that he was the father. By telling us that he was the father.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar. Who's that woman in Michael's office with the feet?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: That's his ex.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, she's very beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, she is. And clinically insane.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: So, listen, I don't know if your offer still stands or whatever, but you can give your yoga teacher my number.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Listen, dummy! It's not that hard. All you have to do is take the numbers from the sales report and type them into a master spreadsheet. A G.D. monkey could do it. I do not understand why you can't do it.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No! You do not talk to him like that!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But he's an idiot!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: He is not an idiot!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you, Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: He is mentally challenged. But he's doing a super job here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, back up. Do you think that I am retarded?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well, no. Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, Holly, that is very offensive.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. So, since my little lady has such particular, impossible to perceive taste, I have made nonrefundable deposits at four totally different wedding locales:  Hot-air balloons over Napa Valley, world-famous Walt Disney's Epcot Center, scuba-diving wedding in the Bahamas and the Wilkes-Barre Marriott Ballroom C.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dangerous. Tacky. Sharks. Haunted. No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [walking into storage room] Hurry, we have to make this fast.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's do this thing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Dwight slaps her butt] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have a nice comforter and several cozy pillows. I usually read a chapter of a book, and it's lights out by 8:30. That's how I sleep at night!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, I am connecting and ... you are not there. Did you install it right? How about this:  Go to applications-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on computer screen] I can see you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is so cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So what is going on, girl in the computer?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Lunch with a girl from my hall.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ceramics class. Then dinner by myself. I'm gonna watch HGTV and maybe go to Bungalow 8 with John Mayer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, can you turn the girl off please? I'm trying to get some work done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No way. No way. Pam Beesley. Hello. [picks up computer] Hey, everybody look, Pam. Pam, say hi. Say hi to Pam. Don't we all look skinny? Oh, oh, almost dropped you!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you put me down I'm getting a little nauseous?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, I'd like you to meet Ronnie. We call her Rice-a-Ronnie. She is hilarious. She is wonderful, a beam of light in this dark, dark office. Not really so much. All she does is plop herself down there and answer phones all day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The nerve.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, calm down, weirdo. It's just a joke. She's such a weirdo! You know what? My real beef with her, though, Pam? She can't find those little colored paper clips that I like so much. Will you help her find them, please?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They're on the supply shelf.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's go. We are following Pam to the supply shelf. Let us go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: New York is so exciting. I love my classes. The city's awesome. Um, can you give me back to Jim now, please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, everybody, let's suck in our guts.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: 2,184 pounds, for a grand total -- oh! You all gained five pounds back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damn it. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Kelly faints] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, Bernard. [Andy spits on floor as warehouse worker walks past]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go. Everybody on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, we're set.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Still good. You guys lost a pound. You lost one pound.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I was on an IV for two days at the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I lost four pounds. I don't know what those other fools were doing, but I lost four pounds.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Angela, you'll go to the supermarket and get the New York cheesecake. Make sure it's the generic one. It's Stanley's favorite.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes, I've replaced Angela as head of the party planning committee. [footage of Dwight and Angela making out] I guess I was just in the right place at the right time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How's it going?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's going well.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I have a crazy idea. What if we did, um, fruit instead of cake?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cake? Who suggested cake? [Angela points to Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We lost weight today. I think it's OK to reward ourselves once in a while.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding me? We only lost one pound, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is wrong with these people? They have no willpower. I went -- I once went 28 years without having sex. And then again for seven years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Does anyone have any idea what the number one cause of death is in this country?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shotgun weddings.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's not what that is.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Fright. Being scared to death.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Obesity-caused illnesses.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Obesity-caused illnesses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. Holly is right. People, this is not just about winning some extra vacation days. This is about a very cool HR initiative that if we don't follow, we are all going to die of obesity. So how much are we gonna lose?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I would like to lose 65 pounds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, all right. Who else? [to Angela] Can I put you down for 10 pounds?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. My doctor wants me to gain weight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you gain weight, you will die. I want you to live forever. I want us all to live forever. How? How are we going to do this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cryogenics. Beer me five.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is how we're gonna do it. Five pounds. I'm asking each of you to lose five pounds. That plus Jim's 65 will give us a very good chance at winning this thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, I'm taking off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Booty call.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, just going to see Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe put up some shelves.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait a second. [removes condom from wallet, throws it to Jim] I don't want you to end up with a surprise pregnancy like me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, thank you for ... this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You want more?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know if there's any one place that has all these things.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's not my problem. [dials phone]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thousand-year-old church in the continental United States. There has to be a rainbow. 24-hour veterinarian on call.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That is very important to me, so -- I have work to do. Just do it. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sweetheart. [Angela turns around] Just so you know, I don't care where we get married. I'll marry you right here in this building. I'll marry you in the parking lot. I'll marry you in the eye of a hurricane in the middle of a snowstorm on top of a monsoon. All I care about is that we're gonna spend the rest of our lives together.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Angela kisses him] Hey-oh!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know I haven't made this easy on you. [Dwight comes out of storage room alone, looks at watch.]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [knocks on door] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi. [they kiss] Mmm. 'Cause- [looks toward camera]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, that's so rude of me. Have you seen, um, Pam's new art? It's right there. Check it out. [closes door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [music playing] It's a pretty lame party.

quotes.speaker: Ronnie
quotes.text: Does anyone want to dance?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [watching baseball game on TV] Some girl came into Pam's room crying about her roommate stealing her soy milk. So I'm in here waiting it out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Stanley, Michael's not here. You can eat a slice of your birthday cake.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't like cake anymore

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why not, dawg?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Tastes changed. Now all I like is baklava.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, we have a situation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They should not be in that room.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: That's so lame they didn't invite us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what we should do? We should have a party and not invite them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's go mini-golfing.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Hey, could I have a rain check on the mini-golf. I, uh, actually have a date tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It'll probably be a total disaster, but...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, I think you'll have fun. Men from Scranton are handsome, and they know how to show a woman a good time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not that guy who murdered his mother. He was not so handsome. Also Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? We're pretty much done here today. Why don't you just take off early?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, that's sweet. Wish me luck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Holly doesn't need luck. Everyone that meets her instantly loves her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Party's over. You are so busted!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, everybody. Phyllis, did I or did I not say fruit?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You said fruit, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And what is that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Cake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, we're gonna have to try a little harder if we are going to win this thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Happy Birthday, Stanley! [kicks cake onto Michael]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's kind of a good news, bad news situation.  The bad news is we're not doing very well, so we really had to starve ourselves this whole week. But the good news is that all the other branches are doing just as bad as we are, so corporate upped the prize to five days.  So if we stay fat long enough, we may actually get a whole month off.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [spreading peanut butter on a bagel] What?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh nothing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's just some of us are taking this really seriously.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I swallowed a tapeworm last night.  It's going to grow up to three feet inside of me and then it eats all my food so that I don't get fat.  And then after three months I take some medicine and then I pass it.  Creed sold it to me.  It's from Mexico.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That wasn't a tapeworm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [walks in the office] How's my favorite branch doing? [no one talks, everyone stares at Ryan] All right [sits at reception].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ronnie was bleh.  Things were at an all time sad here.  But then I got an e-mail from Ryan, that he was coming back to town.  And I called the temp agency and I told them I will pay you any amount, just give me Ryan Howard.  Give him to me.  I want him.  I need him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And you got a goatee!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did you get that after you helped me move and you saw mine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  Gooooo-tee!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Firrrrre-duh guy! [high fives Ryan]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey Kevin... [Kevin gives Ryan a noogie] That's really funny.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's great to see you Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You too.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm keeping a list... of everyone who wrongs me.  So when I'm back on top, they'll be sorry.  Kevin just made the list.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Jim.  I wanted to apologize... for how I treated you last year.  I lost sight of myself and now that I've quit the rat race I've realized there's so much more to life than being the youngest VP in the company's history.  I've even started volunteering.  Giving back to the community.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well that's great.  [shakes Ryan's hand] You're talking about your court ordered community service?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't need a judge to tell me to keep my community clean.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But he did, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [glares into the camera and writes Jim's name on his list]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Well you lost zero pounds. [everyone grumbles]  No change.  On the bright side you gained zero pounds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you know what?  I can't do this by myself people!  Kelly and I are the only ones who have either passed out or almost passed out. [flails his arms]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Damnit, I need these five days for my honeymoon!  Who is slacking?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ok, let's just all try and work harder, ok?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: NO!  I want names!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is the hardest thing I've ever had to do in my entire life.  I haven't had a very hard life.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So how was your date?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Eight point five.  I got a red wine stain on my favorite shirt.  But he's cute, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [groans painfully]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What's wrong?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [struggling to speak] Mmm-- mmm...  Um...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Close the door.  This is your fault.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your stupid friend zone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I should have been lovers with her first and then friends.  That was terrible advice.  Terrible advice!  You know my seduction method.  I like to get in there and get my hands dirty! Wh--  You sabotaged me.  You sabotaged me, man!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention!  Attention!  We only have a few weeks left.  [looking at Phyllis]  And most of you are just as fat as the day we began.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How much weight have you lost, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am hardly the problem, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you're definitely the problem.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is what I'm gonna do.  I'm gonna randomly select three names and these three people will get liposuction.  Uhhhhh Stanley, Phyllis, Kevin.  And you will be responsible for your own medical bills.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, hello Ryan.  You look well.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I wanted to say I'm sorry... for treating you bad the past couple years.  I was in my mid twenties and I was goin' through a lot of stuff.  I think I never fully processed 9/11.  Um, I want you to know I've changed.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We should get a drink later. Catch up.  Pick me up around eight?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh that is so sweet.  Um, but I'm dating Darryl, still, and we're like crazy in love so...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That-- I, um... cool.  Well maybe I'll see you around.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's a small office.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello Phyllis.  Do you have a minute?  Listen.  I'm really sorry... about what I said before.  Ok?  I was way out of line.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes you were.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you know what, I want to make it up to you.  There is a sure fire sale, but it's a two man job.  Interested?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Split the commission?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs] Sixty - forty.  Hm? [they shake hands]  I'll drive.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [exhales, camera shows Kelly and Darryl making out on the reception couch, Kelly looking at Ryan]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Dieting's only half of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.  Saunas.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: And exercise. Although I know everybody loves going to the gym.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gah, the dreadmill. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Probably the weirdest thing about Pam being gone would be lunch... actually.  But um, it will force me to become acquaintances with people I consider... coworkers.

quotes.speaker: Friend
quotes.text: Oh, my God.  Ok.  Everybody just act normal.  Don't say anything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Friend
quotes.text: My ex-girlfriend.  She's right behind you. Just... hide me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really, where?

quotes.speaker: Friend
quotes.text: No no!  Don't look! [Pam sees an old lady behind him]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, was it the age difference?

quotes.speaker: Friend
quotes.text: Uh, actually, kind of.  Yes.  I just didn't like eating dinner that early. [they laugh, Pam's phone rings, she answers]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!  Jim! Um, listen, can I call you back in a little bit?  I made friends!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [storms in the office, sweaty and out of breath] Are you insane?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, hey!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh my God, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: There was no client.  Dwight drove me to an abandoned warehouse five miles away and pushed me out of the car.  I had to walk home with no money and no phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you burned over a thousand calories walking home.  And this branch just got a little bit closer to winning the contest.  Phyllis Vance, ladies and gentlemen! [claps]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You left me in a bad part of town!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I took your purse.  What are you worried about?  [Phyllis storms to her desk, picks up phone and dials]  You look great.  I can definitely see the difference.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [into phone] Phyllis Vance for David Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: "...or that Dunder Mifflin does not discriminate.  Nor does it condone unhealthy dieting habits or extreme weight loss strategies.  As was clearly stated in the official starting--"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in a fat suit, speaking in his Michael Clump voice] Ohhhh!  Bang!  Boom!  Say Clump! Why hello everybody!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fair question.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I say, I say, I say, I say down Holly! I'll take it from here. I am beautiful. [hangs pictures of fat people on the wall, including two fat people on a bike, the Ghostbusters Marshmallow Man, Elvis, Martin Lawrence in Big Mamma's House, Jabba the Hutt, and a fat pig] They are beautiful. He is beautiful.  This big fat pig is beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's my sumo suit.  I just didn't inflate it all the way.  I am so glad that I bought instead of rented.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Body image.  We are here because there is something wrong with society.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See, you're always saying there's something wrong with society, but... maybe there's something wrong with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If it's me, then society made me that way.  Now, I know a lot of you are probably asking yourself, "Why are you dressed in a plus sized suit?"

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Because you're kind of doing Michael Clump.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do you know Michael Clump?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Because it's your making-fun-of-fat-people character.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How dare you! Michael Clump is a celebration of fat people.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think of him as more like... a monster?  What about, "I say, I say, I say, I'll sit on you!"

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, it goes, it goes... look, "I say, I say, I say, I'll sit on you!"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, NO, no!  You know what?  Fat people are not monsters!  Why don't you guys have a little more sensitivity to the subject.  Bang!  Boom!  Case in point!  Look at the outside of this building.  It is ugly.  But you come inside... and it is beautiful.  Just like this unappealing fat suit.  Inside is a rather handsome, sexy, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Vamping.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!  Why don't you just sit down, please?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eh, I've been sitting all day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're doing this because of you.  So why don't you just go stand somewhere else.  [to Ryan] Hey.  Hey.  You shaved?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [at a loss for words]

quotes.speaker: Professor
quotes.text: So, in the year 2000, fungus and even black mold was discovered growing in the cave.  Some blame it on the new air conditioning system they installed.  Some, on the high powered lights. [Pam's friend shows Pam a drawing mocking the professor, they laugh] Others feel that fungus is do to an over--

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to friend] Nice.

quotes.speaker: Professor
quotes.text: Quiet please.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Friend
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, I would like you to apologize to this beautiful, beautiful woman for forcing her to walk five miles, which for her is basically a death march.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She should thank me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok Phyllis, thank Dwight first.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Why should I have to thank him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're right, you're right.  Just, Dwight, do it.  Just say it ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [exhales] I apologize for creating a ruse which forced you to exercise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Finally.  Right?  Ok, Phyllis you must be exhausted from standing on those gams.  Why don't you have a seat?  [Phyllis sits] Let's all clap at Phyllis. [everyone claps] Ok!  [in Michael Clump voice]  When Michael Clump wants to remind you [normal voice] that corporate... their idea, yes, was to urge you to lose weight, but more importantly what this whole thing is about, this contest is really about being healthy.  And in order to be healthy, you have to eat, Kelly.  Kelly.  [kneels down in front of Kelly, Dwight tries to help him down, Michael shouts gibberish at him]  Kelly, I want you to stand up on your chair.  Come on, stand up on your chair.  Stand up, stand up, stand up.  Somebody help her.  Here we go. [Kelly stands up on her chair] Ok, I want you to look at her.  She's a beautiful Indian woman.  Why?  What makes her beautiful?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [stands up] Everything.  She's perfect.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I like her nails.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, be more specific.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I like her fingernails.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I like her purple dress.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about her looks?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hell of an ass.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: ...what else do people like?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I wonder what people like about me? ... Probably my jugs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kelly, will you just agree to stop this mess and stop trying to kill yourself?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I hate dieting, I hate it so much.  I hate this worm inside of me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to know.  Kelly, look at me!   I want you to know that you are beautiful.  You are truly, truly beautiful.  Give me a hug.  [Michael hugs Kelly, his head in her chest] Mmmmmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Summers going great.  Just spent two hours listening to Michael Clump.  I have a weird pain in my left side that I'm convinced is an ulcer.  My girlfriend lives in New York and I haven't seen her in 10 days.  How's your summer?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Ryan, look.  Shaved off my goatee.  I am goateeless.  We are the goateeless brothers.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahaha, Yep! [Dwight looks down depressingly and rubs his new goatee]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How was Friday night?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, I had a good time, but it's been three days and no call.  I even have two tickets to see Counting Crows for tonight, so...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He'll call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, enough with the girl talk please.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You guys lost four pounds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I say we have a parade.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We better.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excellent!  Good job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So as it turns out, tonight is my nephews T-ball game and I kinda missed the first three, so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You've already disappointed him so much.  He can't be expecting a lot from you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.  I suck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, you do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight says "Hi."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do not!  I do not say "Hi" Pam!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now he is saying "Hi" louder.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I... listen, umm, we're still good for this weekend, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Umm...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No football games, recitals, karate tournaments.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, can you go to IM?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: JIM9334
quotes.text: Let's meet for lunch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you writing about me?

quotes.speaker: Receptionitis15
quotes.text: What -- today?

quotes.speaker: JIM9334
quotes.text: Yeah. C'mon we'll meet halfway.  You'll be back for your 4 o'clock class.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna write you both up for not working.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna write you up for not working.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, well played.  Neither of us'll write the other up for not working.

quotes.speaker: Receptionitis15
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: JIM9334
quotes.text: The rest stop where that soda exploded on me.  Exit 17, I think.  1 o'clock.

quotes.speaker: Receptionitis15
quotes.text: Alright. See you there. :

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [holds up an ASCII image of Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, oh, hey.  Did he call?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I just got off... Kendall?  I just got off...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no, did, I heard you talking to Oscar about that guy.  What, what happened?  Did he call?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aach.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: And you know what?  I even got two tickets to see the Counting Crows tonight as a surprise.  Why do guys not call when they say they are gonna call?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I dunno.  I always call everybody back right away.  He'll call back though.  Give him until the end of the day, he'll call.  If he doesn't, he is loco.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Thanks.  That's sweet.  Anyways, umm, seems like we lost to Utica by only eight pounds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well, at least everyone lost weight.  That's all that really matters.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, do we have until the end of the day?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: So we're only eight pounds behind Utica.  Now, I know it's a stretch but we could weigh ourselves again at the end of the day and maybe win this thing after all.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Leave it to me, boss.  I can get this whole office to make weight. [turns up thermostat] It's gonna be a little toasty in here. Good old fashioned sweat lodge.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andy Bernard does not lose contests.  He wins them... or he quits them because they are unfair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Kelly eating in the break room] Hey, is that healthy food?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're trying to win a contest here, Kelly.  Please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Michael.  I just scheduled lunch with a client so I might be back a little late.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, that is fine.  Just water, and be back by weigh-in, ok?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sprays the inside of the vending machine with bug spray]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I hate to even ask because you have been so accommodating about all the wedding stuff.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Your wish is my command.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is there any way our first dance can be to my favorite song, The Little Drummer Boy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of course!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah!  I mean it's a great song.  I always thought it was bigger than Christmas anyway.  You know?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And you know what?  The guys already know it so it's easy breezy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The guys?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn't tell you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm-mm

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Here Comes Treble, class of '96 was available for our big day, so, I booked 'em.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't think that...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And, they are collectively my best man.  And they are crashing with us for three weeks, so... it totally works out.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know if I want your old college a capella group to be our wedding band.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok, I hear you, sweetheart, but this is a deal breaker.  But you know what?  You're gonna love these guys.  Carl 1, Carl 2, Broccoli Rob, Spare Rib, Doobie, Lunch Box, Boner Champ, that's me, Pubie Lewis and the News, Hopscotch, Jingle Jangle, Sandwich.  These are the best best-man a guy could ever hope for.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Angela dials the phone] Let's talk about this later. [Dwight's pager buzzes]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm-wah! [Angela walks away, Dwight follows]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!  This is not half-way!  I did the math.  I had to drive way longer than you.  Montclair would have been closer, so you have to buy lunch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim gets down on one knee]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just... couldn't wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, will you marry me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes! [they embrace and kiss]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God.  Where is Jim?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm calling it.  I guess that's curtains for the yoga guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aww, really?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have to say, I think the problem with that whole thing...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...was that he was a complete stupid idiot.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Aww man, I really wanted to see them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.  I love Counting Crows.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Look at where my seats were.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, really?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a shame.  A shame to waste these.  I want to buy them from you.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael, you don't have to buy them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do.  No.  I do.  I, I want to.  Trust me.  I really do.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.  Alright!  [tears up tickets]  Just, I want you to just forget about him, ok?  Case closed.  Umm, can I pay you tomorrow?  I have like a 60 dollar limit on my ATM, so...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is that good?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, sorry everybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you smiling about there smiley pants?  You're late.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wet Tuna!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's up, Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dripping on me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Darryl, would you do the honors?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Two thousand one hundred seventy-five. [everyone moans] Sorry guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nonono, no, no, I don't want to hear moaning.  This is a good day.  You guys accomplished something big.  You lost a ton of weight, literally.  A lot of weight.  And I don't care what any stupid scale says.  You guys are all gigantic losers.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't know about anyone else.  But it was a good summer for me.  I lost seven pounds.  And you know what?  I'm just gonna take five days off anyway.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [in a hospital bed, watching Entourage in Spanish] Oh, I went zip lining my third day in Costa Rica.  I guess the harness wasn't strapped in exactly right.  I broke my neck.  And, I've been in the hospital five weeks now.  I still haven't seen the beach.  It's nice to have visitors.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Holly] I'm doing the blood type diet.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Who gives a f[bleep]?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What'd you say h[bleep]?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Okay, great.  I got it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look what just arrived from the Nashua branch.  [reads from card attached to gift basket] "Here's something to enjoy on your three non-vacation days.  Nashua branch." Can I send them a dead deer?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you know what we're gonna do?  We're gonna take that and we are going to us it as a reward for the end of our competition.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Classy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My dream vacation?  I sleep in, putter around the farm, go fishing for a few hours, take a long run in the forest, check the traps.  Then the sun comes up and I head into work, which is empty, because everyone else is out of town on vacation.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [seeing Kevin throw out bunch of M&Ms]  Nice job, Kevin. [Kevin fills jar back up with another candy]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm pretty fit.  But in the gay community, there's a lot of pressure to be ripped.  I got straight abs.  I want gay abs.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can you turn the heat down now - it's oppressive.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, totally.  I'm sorry, Oscar.  Yeah, I didn't realize it was bothering you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's just...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: 'Cause it's kind of bothering all of us, 'cause it's really hot, you know, it's hot, so we can lose weight, so we don't screw up this whole contest for the entire freaking office, but if you want, I'll turn it down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, hello.  Hey!  Your face is almost back to normal.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: One more kid calls me "Hellboy," I swear to God...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, you wish.  Hellboy's a hero.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: These guys took me out on their fishing boat.  I don't think I caught anything.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Have you been to the beach yet?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [on the computer] No, but I'm going zip lining tomorrow, through the, through the rainforest, with this cool couple I, I met at my hotel.  Wo-woman's amazing...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar!  Come on, let's go!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, Toby, I gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, is that Michael?  Does he miss me?  [laughs]  Uh, Oscar?  Are you there?  Hello? [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am suspending you without pay for the rest of the year.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you're not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, no, I am not.  Dwight! [Dwight runs into Michael's office]  I want you to take Jim's chair.  No!  No!  His chair at his desk.  He gets it back on Friday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to get your ass out of my face.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sitting on a stack of paper] Yeah, well, if you're only free till three on Sunday and I can't get there till one, then it's gonna be pretty tight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [from his office] That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [as Dwight tries to take paper out from under him] Hey, can you not?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can you not?  No sitting devices, Michael's rules.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, definitely, definitely.  Yes.  Next weekend, then.  All right!  I love you, too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gah! [tries to dislodge paper with his feet]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, um, my daughter said you traded her a headband for her Nintendo DS?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh yeah, she loves that headband.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: She's six.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: She manipulates you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Okay, I'm gonna need you to make this right or else we can't be right.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I never know when you're kidding.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I can't feel... I can't feel anything that you're doing, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It's like nothing's happening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're...you know what?  I read in one of those books that you're not even supposed to give foot massages because it can induce labor.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, just stop making excuses and just dig in there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm digging.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When Michael told us that Jan was pregnant, he led us all to believe that he was the father... by telling us he was the father.  But then we got this e-mail from Jan.  [waves paper and reads from it] "Hi, everyone!  Jan here, writing to share some wonderful news and to quash a rumor.  First, the great news - I am expecting.  The beautiful baby inside me will be ready to meet the world this fall just a few months before the launch of the new Serenity by Jan line (shameless plug, I know, don't hate me, LOL).  Anyway, I also wanted to clarify that the father is not anyone that you or I have ever met.  Remember, no matter how excited someone is about my baby, it does not make them the father.  Best, Jan.  P.S. Hope to ship you something soon."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't wait to be a father.  I'm going to smother that baby.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, new wicks from Craft Corner, uh, this dress [hands Michael bag] returned to Suburban Casuals, and uh, panty liners.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I really, I don't want to get panty liners, please...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I, you said you wanted to help, so I...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, it's...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Will you be able to milk with those implants?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You mean breastfeed?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. [Jan starts to get up] Easy there, old girl. [tries to help her]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, I'm fine, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Would you just call me when you're done with the errands, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as Jan leaves room] Careful.  Hmm.  She was a keeper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to get the panty liners.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Done.
